The lord of the forest who watered it with water refers to the past buddhas being external conditions for oneself, promoting the arising of one's own good, or bestowing a separate prediction.
The tree withered below, which illustrates the Buddha's complete severing of the afflictive hindrances.
Only the true essence remains, as the five aggregates of false and deceptive birth and death are exhausted, leaving only the wondrous basis of the spirit, the true nature of the unconditioned Dharma.
